text: Villanova d'Asti is a town and comune in the province of Asti, Piedmont, northern Italy. It has around 5,000 inhabitants. The economy is based on a mixture of agriculture and industry. Villanova d'Asti was founded in the Middle Ages. The main sight is the sanctuary of the Beata Vergine delle Grazie ==Twin towns — sister cities== Villanova d'Asti is twinned with: * Châteaurenard, France, since 1994 * Santa Clara de Saguier, Argentina, since 2012 ==References== *Official website Category:Cities and towns in Piedmont
